title: Rabbi Shmuley Boteach says he is why Ben Shapiro fired Candace Owens
message:
Living in New York City, I have had the opportunity to cross paths with many influential and well-known figures in the Jewish world.
Not only did Dennis Prager and Ben Shapiro fail to speak out and their silence became deafening, but they actually did speak out and they defended her.
At the very least, Dennis Prager didn’t make money from it, but Ben Shapiro profited and we don’t even know how much.
So what I would say to Ben Shapiro is ‘You have disgraced yourself, and you have disgraced your own moral compass.
The problem is that we only have one percent of the world Jewish community that are actually engaged.

title: University of Toronto graduation ceremonies set to begin with protest in background
message:
Sonja Puzic, The Canadian PressConvocation ceremonies for graduating University of Toronto students begin Monday against the backdrop of a pro-Palestinian encampment that has remained on campus for weeks despite a trespass notice and looming legal action.
More than 30 ceremonies are scheduled to take place through June 21 and the university says all events will proceed as planned with "extra precautions."
The University of Toronto said it takes the safety of graduating students and their guests “extremely seriously” and has a “well established” process to handle event disruptions.
An encampment at McGill University has been in place for more than a month, forcing the administration to move graduation ceremonies off campus to the Bell Centre, home of the Montreal Canadiens.
McGill president Deep Saini expressed frustration that encampment representatives walked away from the last meeting aimed at ending their protest.

title: Parade for Israel in NYC focuses on solidarity as Gaza war casts a grim shadow
message:
The parade comes almost eight months after the unprecedented Oct. 7 attack by Hamas, the deadliest in Israel's history.
There was never a thought of cancelling the parade this year, Treyger said, despite what he termed an astronomical rise in antisemitism.
That includes drones, K-9 units, bike patrols, fencing and barriers and designated entry points for spectators all along the parade route.
“We're not going to allow any unlawfulness and any disruption of any celebration of one’s heritage in this city,” New York City Mayor Eric Adams said at a security briefing.
Israel faces growing international criticism for its strategy of systematic destruction in Gaza, at a huge cost in civilian lives.

title: Parade for Israel in NYC Focuses on Solidarity This Year as Gaza war Casts a Grim Shadow
message:
An annual New York City parade for Israel that draws thousands of people is scheduled to hit the streets Sunday with heightened security and a focus on solidarity during the war in Gaza.
The parade comes almost eight months after the unprecedented Oct. 7 attack by Hamas, the deadliest in Israel's history.
There was never a thought of cancelling the parade this year, Treyger said, despite what he termed an astronomical rise in antisemitism.
“We're not going to allow any unlawfulness and any disruption of any celebration of one’s heritage in this city,” New York City Mayor Eric Adams said at a security briefing.
Israel faces growing international criticism for its strategy of systematic destruction in Gaza, at a huge cost in civilian lives.

“Folks graduating should attend (convocation) if they want to and we’re not taking any public stance on that,” Rasikh said.
“Please explain how U of T plans on ensuring a safe and meaningful graduation ceremony,” the parent wrote.

title: Israel Day on Fifth : NYPD heightens security as Gaza war casts a grim shadow over parade
message:
Israel Day on Fifth Parade will feature heightened security measuresReagan Medgie is live along the parade route with more.
Reagan Medgie is live along the parade route with more.
Reagan Medgie is live along the parade route with more.
NEW YORK CITY (WABC) -- The annual New York City parade for Israel that draws thousands of people is scheduled to hit the streets Sunday with heightened security and a focus on solidarity during the war in Gaza.
That includes drones, K-9 units, bike patrols, fencing and barriers and designated entry points for spectators all along the parade route.

title: NYPD Bracing for Sunday Israel Day Parade , Pro - Hamas Violence Anticipated | The Jewish Press - JewishPress . com | David Israel | 25 Iyyar 5784 – Sunday , June 2 , 2024
message:
We will address it accordingly.”To allow the event to proceed safely, the NYPD plans a highly visible security presence at the parade.
Spectators can expect to see officers on bikes, K-9 units, transit police, and counterterrorism personnel providing heightened security measures.
Israel Day on Fifth (formerly the Salute to Israel Parade, and later the Celebrate Israel Parade), held annually in New York City since 1964, travels north on Fifth Avenue from 57th Street to 74th Street.
This year participants will march from 62nd Street up to 74th Street.
One person here has an 86-year-old grandfather still kept there.”Several hostage families will lead Sunday’s parade.

title: Shooting alone : How decades of war have reshaped America priorities
message:
Surgeon General Vivek Murthy recently highlighted the problem, claiming that loneliness was as dangerous to our health as smoking 15 cigarettes a day.
What Donald Trump and other MAGA leaders have done is take emotions like loneliness and channel them into a social movement.
Reason and self-control prove elusive at such moments in a world infused with racial slurs as solace for peoples’ woes.
Much has been made lately of antisemitic chants at the student protests against the Israel-Gaza war and the American weaponry eternally being shipped to Israel.
I recently participated with a family friend in a race in deep blue Syracuse, New York, meant to benefit local community-based health care.
